thread.title: Solana Faces Major Setback as PEPE and IntelMarkets Attract $100K Capital From Wall Street Investors
thread.title_full: Solana Faces Major Setback as PEPE and IntelMarkets Attract $100K Capital From Wall Street Investors

author: Jack R. Mitchell
title: Solana Faces Major Setback as PEPE and IntelMarkets Attract $100K Capital From Wall Street Investors
text:
Solana faces setbacks as Wall Street investors pivot $100K into PEPE and IntelMarkets, the AI crypto with 45x growth potential and revolutionary trading technology.
Recently, Solana’s (SOL) setbacks have been in the news, which has caused investors to reconsider their positions. Meanwhile, Wall Street investors repositioned about $100,000 worth of capital in new emerging cryptos like PEPE and IntelMarkets (INTL). In this shift lies a rising curiosity in the realm of innovative digital assets that bring varied value propositions and promise high returns.
Solana (SOL): Facing Market Volatility After Gensler’s ‘Parting Gift’ Known for speedy blockchain capabilities and support for decentralized applications, Solana’s price has experienced slight corrections from its recent ATH rally. According to CoinMarketCap, SOL trades at $214, which has decreased 2.65% in the last 24 hours. Even worse news for Solana holders is that the SOL price tumbled further this week, with a 6.57% downswing. That still leaves the cryptocurrency about 18% below its ATH of $263.83, reached on November 23 2024.
This volatility can be attributed to many factors, including scrutiny faced by many Solana-based meme coins, fierce competition, and the rejection of the SOL ETF. As one of the final actions by the current head of the SEC, Gary Gensler, he denied Solana’s ETF as a final ‘parting gift’ before he leaves office in January. However, some Wall Street investors are worrying about SOL’s short-term outlook and are looking to reposition their money in other investments.
IntelMarkets (INTL): The AI-Powered Trading Platform Poised for Growth IntelMarkets (INTL) has appeared as a new cryptocurrency that combines artificial intelligence (AI) with decentralized finance (DeFi) to change crypto trading. It uses an AI-driven trading platform that provides some of the most advanced trading tools, such as self-learning algorithms that are able to complete complex transactions between multiple markets at breakneck speeds.
Why Wall Street Investors Are Pivoting to IntelMarkets The strategic shift of capital from established cryptocurrencies like Solana to innovative projects such as IntelMarkets can be attributed to several factors:
Innovative Technology: INTL’s unique value proposition is its fusion of AI and blockchain technology, that brings trading efficiency and user experience to a higher level. Growth Potential: As with any new low market cap entrant, IntelMarkets has a much higher upside compared to older, huge cap cryptocurrencies. Market Dynamics: Due to the current market environment, investors are now looking for opportunities in new, up-and-coming projects that offer revolutionary solutions and chances for considerable gain. Right now, in the 8th phase of its Initial Coin Offering (ICO), INTL tokens can be bought for $0.073 each. The project has raised over $4,820,000 from early investors already. Run by a team of MIT and Open AI alumni, the project drew heavy interest from Fortune 500 and Wall Street investors who invested $500,000 and $100,000 respectively. Analysts predict a 45x launch price increase, making IntelMarkets a worthwhile investment in this current market climate.
PEPE: The Ethereum Meme Coin Capturing Investor Attention An Ethereum based meme coin known, PEPE has been on the radar of many traders. As Ethereum breaks the $4k barrier and investors are shifting from Solana, the frog-themed meme coin is one investment Wall Street investors are looking into. Currently priced at $0.000023, a 6% increase in the last 24 hours. Still, PEPE has fallen 17% since it reached its all time high on December 9, 2024, when it posted $0.000028.
Since its launch in April 2023, PEPE has experienced massive growth as early investors who enjoyed outstanding returns. As the meme coin community rejoices at PEPE’s $10 billion market cap, some investors are wondering if it can replicate its 400x gains. Being a meme coin with a large market cap, PEPE’s maturity limits its potential when compared to up-and-coming projects like IntelMarkets.
Conclusion Solana (SOL) remains a big player in the blockchain ecosystem, however, recent market turmoil has caused investors to look elsewhere. IntelMarkets (INTL) has shown considerable growth prospects since it has an AI driven trading platform. As PEPE shows signs of maturity, INTL has been the go-to investment for Wall Street recently.
